result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must seek and maintain full-time employment which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means, with the victims listed in the complaint.    

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

records.addlTxt: $0 - faxed a copy to Probation
Sent Restitution Order to Judge from Probation
of JOC
from DOC.  Sent electronically to Judge Becker on 3/4/16.

Reading of the information waived.  Defendant plead guilty to Counts 1 and 3 as charged.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  $1,000.00 restitution request on behalf of K.O.  Courts 2, 4 and 5 to be dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court advised the defendant of the possible penalties of the charges he is pleading to.  He understood.  Priors confirmed by the court.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.   Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Counts 1 and 3.  State requesting 30 days to document the amount of restitution requested.  State recommended probation.  3 years concurrent.  No contact with the victims listed in the complaint.  Restitution TBD.  AODA.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obtain and maintain employment.  Attorney Belzer requesting concurrent with probation now serving.  Joint recommendation for probation.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 years probation. Concurrent.  No contact with the victims listed in the complaint.  Restitution TBD. To be paid monthly through probation.  Restitution left open for 30 days.  If no response within 30 days, deemed zero.   AODA, if agent recommends.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obtain and maintain employment. Not to terminate without agent approval.  CC, DNA surcharge.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
Information filed with the court.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Belzer.  Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of the preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.
